name: 臺灣歷史與教學研討
goals: To understand the latest academic research of Taiwan history in English literature
To practice translating knowledge of Taiwan history into feasible verbal communication
To learn latest international research progress in order to improve and reflect in one’s own research topic
To exercise one’s related research topic in presentation or teaching curriculum via the media of English
syllabus:
【16+2weeks】

1.  Course requirement
2.  Basic knowledge of Taiwan history in English literature
3.  Austronesian Taiwan and her archeological finding
4.  Taiwan in the Eastern Seas in the 17th century
5.  Into Qing realm
6.  Transformation of the Taiwan “society”
7.  A new prospect for Taiwan in the late 19th century
8.  Mid-term week
9.  Taiwan in 1895
10.  The “New Japan” and Colony「
11.  Taiwan in wartime
12.  De-colonisation and re-colonisation
13.  The time of an authoritarian rule
14.  Democratic Taiwan
15.  Taiwan and China
16.  End-of-term discussion
17.  17th week
18.  18th week

\*The syllabus and schedule may vary according to students’ actual participation and attendance

methodologies.note: One-hour lecture will be given according to topics in weekly schedule
Students are required to read weekly assigned readings, and transform them into presentation, mock teaching, or scholarly discussion
Discussion for all participating students will be held after exercise every week

grading.note: Students are required to provide a 3-page written plan in English for topic and issues scheduled to practice, present, or teach

prerequisite: ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
